file_content.text: ...so, congratulations to you, Ensign Sarven, on your noble sacrifice.
But, sir, I--wait, no, sir, no--I--aargh!
Ah. Exquisite. I will be requiring more rakghouls for my work, Vorzoth.
We already gave you the rakghouls you asked for. When will you do as we asked?
As soon as the weapon is completed. With it, we will decimate the Republic outpost.
I smell an intruder!
So you do. Sergeant, is that really you?
I've moved up in the world since you last saw me.
It's lieutenant, now.
So I see. You've slaughtered enough Republic enemies to be rewarded, then. Well done.
It's not too late to end this peacefully, Needles.
You can still surrender.
It's time to pay for what you've done, traitor.
Ready to die?
I see you aren't alone--you've brought that pathetic worm all the way from Ord Mantell, just to die along with you.
Talk all you want, Dorant. You're not getting out of here alive.
Your timing is impeccable. Just as I find myself with plenty of pathogen but no more test subjects, you arrive.
The transformation will hurt at first, but that's merely your organs rupturing and realigning. It's all over quickly, I assure you.
It's nice of you to offer, but I think I'll pass.
No thanks.
I'm not getting turned into one of those things!
Get away from me!
The only thing ending quickly here is your life.
Think again.
Struggle if you must, then. But you'll wish you hadn't made it so hard on yourself.
Vorzoth, please assist me in subduing our newest volunteer.
With pleasure.
Fire at will!
Let's do this!
Let's go!
I had hoped it wouldn't come to this, Needles.
You leave me no choice.
Don't get ahead of yourself.
Nice knowing you, Needles.
Take them.
Take her.
Take him.
I take it you're to blame for the Coruscant relay's destruction. We've been busy, haven't we?
Just give it up, Needles.
But I haven't finished my research, you see, and it would pain me to leave such a magnificent project incomplete.
I killed Jek Kardan on Coruscant.
Kardan's dead.
Kardan was useless, old--putrefied in body and mind. Why Tavus and the others continued to admire him is beyond me.
I convinced Jek Kardan to give up on your insane defection.
Kardan changed sides on you.
Senility has clearly ravaged the old man's mind. I knew he'd outlasted his usefulness to us.
Your pal on Nar Shaddaa didn't finish his mission, either.
I took down Andrik, too.
Your point? Andrik was a broken man. Killing him was the greatest favor you could've done for him at this point.
Every Havoc traitor will pay, Needles. You just get to pay first.
You're only the beginning.
You're giving me the opportunity to kill you before anyone else? How kind.
I see you aren't alone--you've forced this mechanical monstrosity to come all the way out here, just to be destroyed along with you.
Degraded traitor--your threats and mockery will not save you from the Republic's swift justice.
For the Republic!
